non_cve_findings.message: Potential SQL injection vulnerability in pricing engine query builder. User input is concatenated directly into SQL query without parameterization.
Hardcoded database credentials found in configuration file. Credentials should be stored in environment variables or secrets manager.
JWT secret key is too weak (less than 32 characters). This makes tokens vulnerable to brute force attacks.
XML External Entity (XXE) injection vulnerability in medical records parser. XML parser is configured to process external entities.
Cryptographically weak random number generator used for session token generation. Use crypto.randomBytes instead of Math.random.
Path traversal vulnerability in policy document download endpoint. User-controlled input is used to construct file paths without validation.
CORS policy allows all origins (*). This exposes the API to cross-origin attacks.
No rate limiting configured on authentication endpoint. This makes the endpoint vulnerable to brute force attacks.
Sensitive PII data (SSN, DOB) is being logged in plaintext. This violates HIPAA and GDPR requirements.
Open redirect vulnerability in OAuth callback handler. User-controlled redirect URL is not validated against whitelist.

assertions.detail: CRITICAL: This vulnerability is actively exploited in the wild (KEV). Pricing engine is internet-facing and processes untrusted input. Immediate patching required. Temporary mitigation: Set log4j2.formatMsgNoLookups=true
LOW PRIORITY: SSRF requires user-controlled URLs. Our implementation only makes requests to pre-configured partner endpoints. Scheduled for next maintenance window.
HIGH PRIORITY: While connection strings are from env vars (not direct user input), this is still exploitable if env vars are compromised. Upgrade scheduled for this week.
MEDIUM PRIORITY: Code review confirms lodash.template is not used anywhere in codebase. Only safe utility functions are used. Upgrade planned for next sprint.
LOW PRIORITY: Error logs are not exposed to end users and are only accessible to authorized security personnel. Upgrade scheduled for Q1 2026.
